intro: Kirganelia timorensis, commonly known as the Timor kirkana, is a flowering plant native to the island of Timor. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
